articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Chinese government cultural delegation participating in the 23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
 The gift was handed to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 10 by Shan Jixiang, director of the State Administration of Cultural Heritage of China, who is leading the delegation.

Stockpile of 600,000 Tons of War Supplies in S. Korea by U.S. Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The stockpile of a huge amount of war supplies in south Korea by the United States for "an event of contingency" on the Korean Peninsula has been newly disclosed to the public, according to south Korean KBS on April 8.
 All sorts of bullets, bombs, missiles and other war materials stored up at the military arsenals of the U.S. forces in south Korea reportedly run into 600,000 tons.    
 Having turned south Korea into the biggest nuclear war depot in the Far East, the United States is driving the situation of the Korean Peninsula to a higher pitch of strain while getting more undisguised in its aggressive designs on the DPRK.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation
23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival Opens
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegation 
    Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on April 10 had friendly talks with the Chinese government cultural delegation led by Shan Jixiang, director of the State Administration of Cultural Heritage, on a visit to the DPRK to participate in the 23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
 On hand were Choe Chang Il, vice-chairman of the Organizing Committee of the festival, and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
